channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Lally Seeking Interest in Multidisciplinary Student Consultancy Club
item.description: Lally School of Management is looking to support a multidisciplinary student consultancy club that will be open to all RPI students, supported by Lally, and have leadership that includes students in Lally majors. The consultancy’s mission will be to foster and facilitate challenge-based learning through project-oriented management consulting. Please take a moment to complete this form if you’re interested in taking on such a leadership position!
item.author: Students

item.title: OGE to Hold Welcome for New Graduate Students
item.description: Date: Wednesday, January 8, 2025 12:30 PM - 3:00 PM - Graduate students are welcome to attend the Office of Graduate Education’s gathering, which will cover essential campus information, academic policies and procedures, and other relevant topics.
item.author: Students

item.title: Looking to Move into an Apartment?
item.description: Date: Thursday, January 9, 2025 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - All students are welcome to attend this session to learn how to search for — and explore the considerations for selecting — an apartment, as well as get information on the resources that the Off-Campus Commons has to offer.
item.author: Students

item.title: Fellowship Info Session to Highlight Competitions for Grad School Salary and Tuition
item.description: Date: Wednesday, January 15, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Competitive fellowships provide salary and tuition for Masters and PhD students. All graduate students, juniors, seniors, and international students are welcome to attend this session to learn how to find and apply to appropriate programs that will fund fall 2026 and beyond. Register to attend or just drop in!
item.author: Students

item.title: OIP Schedules Study Abroad Welcome Back and Info Session
item.description: From 4:00PM to 5:00PM on Wednesday, January 8 in the CBIS Bruggeman Room, all undergraduates — and particularly students who would like to study abroad in summer/fall 2025 — are encouraged to join the Office of International Programs as they welcome fall Study Abroad students back to campus to hear about their experiences, as well as learn about study abroad opportunities, application processes, and deadlines. Cookies and cocoa will be provided!
item.author: Students

item.title: Bay Area RPI School of Architecture Alumni Experience to be Held January 27
item.description: School of Architecture alumni are invited to attend the first-ever Bay Area RPI School of Architecture Alumni Experience, scheduled to be held from 6PM to 8PM on Monday, January 27, 2025, when Chuck Oraftik ’66 has graciously arranged for attendees to gather at his former firm, HOK Inc., in San Francisco. Space is limited; RSVP ASAP and no later than January 20, 2025!

item.title: “The Thacher Computing Instrument: The Supercomputer of the 19th Century” to be Topic of RPIrates Monthly Meeting
item.description: In celebration of Rensselaer 200, RPIrates: The RPI Users Group, will kick off 2025 at 6:00PM on January 8 in Amos Eaton 217 with a special RPIrates Computing History Talk about the famous Thacher Computing Instrument, invented by RPI graduate Edwin Thacher (1863); Dr. John Erickson will discuss the instrument’s history, explain its theory of operation and demonstrate its use.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum One computer down for maintenance 01/08/2025 6am to 2pm ET and 01/15/2025 9am to 2pm ET
item.description: IBM will be performing system maintenance on all quantum computers, including RPI’s Quantum One computer, on January 8, 2025 from 6am to 2pm ET and January 15, 2025 from 9am to 2pm ET. All QPUs will be unavailable during these times. Users will be unable to submit or retrieve jobs during the maintenance.

item.title: Last Call: HelioCampus Virtual Syllabus Assistance Being Offered January 17
item.description:
Date: Friday, January 17, 2025 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Per requirements from the Provost’s office, faculty should have their syllabi published in HelioCampus by January 20, 2025. Those needing HelioCampus syllabus assistance may contact Learning Assessment Specialist Amy Svirsky.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
